channel.title: Need help running a game without a CD
channel.description: i couldnt figure out if this should go in the computer hardware or not so sorry if it does...but ive looked around on google on how to run a game without a cd and its possible but it only gives me tuts on how to do it with downloaded games over the internet. (ive downloaded this game using the cd) maybe its all the same but hell i have no idea. im just asking for some help. i want to run it without the cd because its shit and screws up. is there any solution to this? thanks.

item.title: Need help running a game without a CD
item.dc:creator: @TLitten TLitten
item.description:
@TLitten wrote:

[quote=“bowserjr2, post:6, topic:290124”]NO-CD crack is the easiest way.

gamecopyworld.com you will find everything you need there.[/quote]

thanks bowserjr2, i think i got it working perfectly now.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help running a game without a CD

item.title: Need help running a game without a CD
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Newty:

If you actually have the CD at the moment, just mount it to a virtual drive (see powerIso) and run it from there. Then you will no longer need the CD.

But of course he would first have to rip said CD and store a 700MB-4GB file…

Read full topic
item.source: Need help running a game without a CD

item.title: Need help running a game without a CD
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

Some games have ‘micro-images’ that can be 10-50MB and mounted to the loop-back adapter (daemon tools, etc). Google for them.

Read full topic
item.source: Need help running a game without a CD

item.title: Need help running a game without a CD
item.dc:creator: @Tico135 Tico
item.description:
@Tico135 wrote:

[quote=“TLitten, post:3, topic:290124”][quote author=Tico link=topic=383510.msg2878935#msg2878935 date=1248211572]
Could you not make an image of the game by using a program such as Nero? Then mount the image with either PowerISO or Daemon Tools, and you should be able to install and run it. I strongly recall that being the way to do it, can someone confirm?
[/quote]
sounds great lol, but it seems way over my head, i guess i can look around google for a tut, but hell who knows.
EDIT- thanks for the speedy reply ;)[/quote]

http://club.cdfreaks.com/f48/how-make-iso-image-using-nero-v7-7-5-1-a-215285/ should probably help you out.

Read full topic
